column4: i just installed about 15 apps from synaptic...i dont remember the names of them....and they arent in the menu.....is there any way to auto add them to it?
if they have menu items, they will be added automatically
gotdot, kk.....looks like im bumed out
that's not realtime zooming yet
expose is not possible in any sane way with X as is
ah ?
i bet your kernel believed it first :)
load your sound card's module in /etc/modules
cool :)
whn will be out the next release ?
I don't ask kde support
yes thanks

well I manage to have kde apps appearing by tweaking the .desktop files in /usr/sahere/applications, but maybe there is hack to do somwhere to have them always in good format or accepted in gnome menu
are you a programmer ?
I code, maybe you could indicate me where to search if I want to try fixing that before nect release ?
ok, I will check that I am curious
where you see nautilus crashes, please click the 'report to developers' button in the crash dialogue
it crashes so many times I can't even tell what is the common behavior that produce a bug
that's fine; whenever it happens, click on the report to developers button. that sends a backtrace.
it's doubly useful if you install nautilus-dbg
that provides more information for the backtrace
if nautilus crashes that regularly for you, then perhaps you use it very differently to most other people, so providing that feedback will help greatly
